# Testing Collatz conjecture

The Collatz conjecture is one of the most famous unsolved problems in mathematics.

Given the two arithmetic operations on a number:

1. For even numbers, divide by 2;
2. For odd numbers, multiply by 3 and add 1.
3. Repeat.

...the conjecture checks **whether all positive integers converge to 1** with enough repetitions of the above two
operations. The conjecture has been shown to hold for all positive integers up to 2.95Ã—10<sup>20</sup>, but no general
proof has been found.

I first came to know about Collatz conjecture from a Veritasium YouTube video. Watch the full video for more
illustrations and interesting discussions on the topic.

[![YouTube](http://i.ytimg.com/vi/094y1Z2wpJg/hqdefault.jpg)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=094y1Z2wpJg)

## The code

Today's code contains two functions:

1. `conjectureTest(n)`: This function returns only when the given number `n` reduces to 1.
2. `conjecture(n)`: This function assumes the conjecture is true for the given number `n` and returns the steps by which
   it reduces to 1.
